content: "In recent months, Somalia's neighbor, Kenya, has signed memorandums of understanding with the United States, Britain, and the European Union to accept suspected pirates and to prosecute them in Kenya. But those agreements have come under fire from local and international human rights groups and lawyers, who argue that Kenya has yet to pass relevant laws regarding piracy and that its corrupt judicial system cannot be trusted to conduct free and fair trials. " Full article: "http://www.voanews.com/english/2009-04-08-voa67.cfm"
reply: "In recent months, Somalia's neighbor, Kenya, has signed memorandums of understanding with the United States, Britain, and the European Union to accept suspected pirates and to prosecute them in Kenya. But those agreements have come under fire from local and international human rights groups and lawyers, who argue that Kenya has yet to pass relevant laws regarding piracy and that its corrupt judicial system cannot be trusted to conduct free and fair trials. " Full article: "http://www.voanews.com/english/2009-04-08-voa67.cfm"

content: He can sing like a canary, but I say he polishes the plank before he walks it...shark bait...in the Court of Neptune, he'll be well eaten...one less reckless, greedy, lawbreaking individual to deal with. Then we deal with Somalia differently than we did back in 1993; give 'em real "shock & awe", having learned from the "Blackhawk Down" incident. These thugs only understand when they are thoroughly hit, overrun and subdued. That's how it is, like it or not. Any lesser objective just won't work. They have to understand the serious potential consequences of their actions, no matter how they justify them. Get in there, drive the problem-causing Moslems out, and start feeding the people with all the food we send there, which is just sitting on the docks instead of feeding the starving masses. Clean house. Deal with the criminal Somalian warlords swiftly, aggressively and purposefully. Get the Christian Ethiopians to help stabilize and reform Somalia. Make Islamic extremism and jihadism a serious crime, and instill a sense of unity and hope in the ragtag people who don't 'live' there...they only 'exist'. I've been there...I personally know the situation in Somalia. Mogadishu, Berbera, Eyl...it's time to put the pirates and the other thugs out of business once and for all. Somalia is ripe for all kinds of awful pestilence to occur and be based. A policy or course of inaction is the worst 'action' we can take in dealing with this situation. No more half-done 'backing down' or weak, gutless vascillating. No more Marines being dragged through the streets of the cities by hoodlums; we tackle this one to WIN, period! Time to get rid of the criminal vermin and clean house, top to bottom. No more status quo.
